intro: Ouratea coriacea, commonly known as the rough ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive foliage. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are often rough to the touch, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by spherical, woody fruits. Ouratea coriacea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
